name: Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites San Francisco Fisherman's Wharf

reviews.text: This a a great base for a San Fran vacation. We stayed here for one nite before transferring across the street to the Hyatt for a conference. We preferred this hotel, hands down! Staff was warm and accomodating. Rooms were well-sized and comfortable. As a Priority Club member we were upgraded to a "suite" with a microwave and refridgerator. Rooms were very clean with comfortable beds. Our check out was delayed for 10 minutes and were offered a free movie for the inconvenience (without asking..) Cable car stop is steps from the hotel, as well as Fisherman's wharf, Pier 39, Giardelli Square and sweeping views of the Bay, Golden Gate Bridge and Alcatraz. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Great base for the San Fran tourist!

reviews.text: Booked this hotel through Hotwire because it was the best deal we could get for our trip. The location is great for first time tourists to SF because it is close to Fisherman's Wharf, a Trolley Car, and a short walk up Columbus to 'Little Italy' and Chinatown. Lombard Street and Coit Tower are also within walking distance.
reviews.title: Decent hotel, good tourist location

reviews.text: The hotel itself is clean and the beds were comfortable. They were not able to offer us rooms with 2 beds, so gave us rooms with King beds and offered up a roll-away bed for free.
reviews.title: Comfy Room

likes.disliked: — no restaurant or bar in the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Free breakfast included a few cereals, toast, donuts, fruits, cinnamon rolls and muffins. Coffee, juice, and milk were also available.
reviews.title: Central to eveyrthing

likes.disliked: — Not enough tea and coffee eg milk and sugar

reviews.text: Free internet access in the lobby
reviews.title: Worth it!

reviews.text: My family and I booked this hotel for the last day of our vacation before we returned to Vancouver. I saw the reviews online but I did not expect the hotel to be this nice. We paid ~210 for 1king and sofa bed for a stay on New Years Day Dec31 07. We were going to stay at Best Western near SFO but ended up here because of its great location near the Wharf. It's only a ~5minute walk there! The staff were all courteous and polite. The rooms look pretty new and everything seems to be in shape, no leaky faucets, squeeky bath tubs, busted light bulbs..etc. My only complaint in the pricey $39 parking, which isnt even valet. But I guess thats the market price around this area of the city anyway. The security in this hotel seems to be pretty good. There were people watching over the parkade and room keys are needed to access the hotel guest rooms. I will definately stay here again in the future if we come back to San Francisco.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

likes.disliked: — parking and having to go across from my building to access printers

reviews.text: My wife loves SF, so when her 50th birthday rolled around, that's where she wanted to go. I got a very good deal on Hotwire for two nights. The rooms are standard fare, very clean, large bathroom, firm, queen beds. A closet safe, TV, table and chairs, coffee maker, thick towels, internet access, hair dryer and all the stuff that we have come to expect in most of the better hotels enhances our stay.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location

reviews.text: We're off and running. Two easy blocks, slightly downhill to the Fisherman's Wharf. Strolling, observing, stopping for snacks. I even got pulled into a street performance. They needed a slightly overweight, big guy, to pick up the girl and stand on the performers chest as he laid in broken glass. My daughter was slightly embarrassed by the whole thing but my wife was cracking up. We ate well, spent a little more than normal in the tourist trap, but for the most part it was very good... My wife is partial to fish and crab.. and the wharf is a good place to find it
reviews.title: Exceeded expectations

likes.liked: — location, cleanliness and condition of the room

reviews.text: The next day, after the continental breakfast, (which we all loved and felt was quite complete and generous) we decided to take the bus to the Union Square for shopping. $1.50 a head, with free transfer. We rode thru the Chinese area on the way. Many older ladies got on with their shopping bags and gossiped at breakneck speed. As we passed, I noticed the stores selling food were jammed. I felt transported to a crowded Asia. I quietly commented to my Asian wife that she will look right at home on this bus in a few years chatting with all the old ladies.. That comment was overheard by the lady sitting across from us who laughed out loud upon hearing it. We chatted with her and had some laughs. We had fun shopping in the stores. Macy's has 7 floors on each side of the street, 7 for men, 7 for women. That was pretty cool.. I bought my wife a nice gift.
reviews.title: Great Location, nice hotel

reviews.text: A reasonable $10 fare to take us taxi back to the hotel.. We rested, then strolled some more, all jacketed and ready for the cold San Francisco nights. We slept well that night and came home safely.
reviews.title: Not worth the price paid

reviews.text: My husband and I brought our infant son to the US to attend my sister's wedding and we stayed at the Holiday Inn Express while we were in San Francisco. The location was perfect because it was right where the action was along the bay, and there was a Walgreens conveniently nearby, as well as the train station that could take us downtown for shopping. The hotel was clean, the room was a good size, and for the amount we paid, I could say that it was good value. The only complaint we would have was that we asked for a crib upon check-in and it was only by the third day when we followed up that they actually brought it. Also, due to the volume of guests, sometimes you'd have to wait for your turn in the elevator and in getting attended to at the reception.
reviews.title: good location hotel

reviews.text: Would defo recommend this hotel! Staff are friendly and helpful, very clean and fantastic location...very jealous to all the people who are going to stay here!
reviews.title: Lovely hotel in a fab location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just visited San Francisco and stayed at Holiday Inn Express. This hotel is situated in a great location - 2 blocks up from the Wharf. We rented a car and found it fairly easy to get to China Town, Union Square and Lombard St.
reviews.title: Great Location and Clean!

reviews.text: The hotel itself is nice, clean comfortable rooms. Don't expect a great veiw though. The breakfast (included in price) is very reasonable.
reviews.title: It was a place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As strangers to San Francisco we didn't know what to expect from the hotel, but were very pleased with our stay there. Oh, parking is an additional fee - as is everywhere else in SF.
reviews.title: Acceptable, but not exciting

reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights on the May long weekend
reviews.title: Holiday inn Sanfrancisco

likes.liked: — easy to get around lots to see all within walking distance great restaraunts flea market shopping everywere

reviews.text: they did give us the wrong room 1 bed instead of 2
reviews.title: Great location, and MORE!

likes.disliked: — no pool or hot tub, but we knew that before we went !

reviews.text: but they did sort it out, rooms , and bathrooms were very clean
reviews.title: Great location! Quite pricey though.

reviews.text: A 2 block walk to the tram and the warf. No pool but the holiday innn Next door does have one you can use. There contental
reviews.title: great hotel,great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2003, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: breakfast now has eggs and either a sausge round or bacon.
reviews.title: Smoke Smell

reviews.text: The staff was very friendly, the beds were extremely comfortable and the location is outstanding. Everything seemed very clean. Two thumbs up from me!
reviews.title: I would stay here again!

reviews.text: My family of 4 just spent a night at the Holiday Inn Express, and were pleasantly surprised with the great location and comfort of the room. We had a family suite on the second floor. It was VERY large, with a living room, small kitchenette and a huge bathroom. It was nicely decorated, with a marble sink, and nice furniture. It was everything we needed to hang out after a long day of traipsing around the city. My husband & I could read in the living room while the kids watched TV on the beds. The free continental breakfast was perfectly adequate, with a variety of pastries, cereal & fruit. And the location is great - just a few blocks from Fisherman's Wharf, Ghirardelli Square & the cable cars. We had to book at the last minute, without shopping around much, but we thought it was a bargain for $225, and I'm sure with some shopping around, you could get a better price on Expedia or Priceline. If we were to come back to SF and had a week, this is definitely where we would stay - it has everything.
reviews.title: Holiday Inn Express is a great deal

likes.liked: — The size of the room and the location

reviews.text: I'm just wrapping up a stay in San Fran's Holiday Inn Express in Fisherman's Wharf. Overall I would rate this experience as above average. The entire 4 days we were in the city it rained/downpoured, but we were entertained none the less. The hotel was nice and clean with the staff always around. Our room was on the second floor, but we hardly ever heard the road and we're pretty light sleepers. They serve a continental breakfast in the morning which is nothing extravagant but a nice little meal before you start your day. The have internet in the rooms and two computers for community use down in the lobby. The computers are pretty old though and there is always people waiting so I'd bring your own if you are going to email often.
reviews.title: Better than expected

reviews.text: Parking is pricy, but seeing as how we were on business work paid...$37 a night.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: Try "Mood- Thai foor and Sushi" on Beach St. one block away. Yellow curry and pineapple fried rice were oh so good and pretty inexpensive.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: This is a perfect hotel if you want to be close to the main tourist attractions. Located just around the corner from the waterfront, you can easily walk to all the wonderful restaurants down at Fisherman's Wharf. The ferry to Alcatraz is an easy 10 minute walk and the hop-on-hop-off bus stop is less than 5 minutes walk. You'll also find a number of bike hire places close by and cycling over the Golden Gate Bridge is a must. The hotel rooms were very clean and whilst not huge, ours was big enough for the four of us. A basic breakfast is provided however it really is basic, but I guess enough to get you started on your day. The staff were very friendly and welcoming. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to do the tourist thing in San Francisco.
reviews.title: Perfect Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in an ideal spot, within walking distance of the main attractions around fishermans
reviews.title: I left my heart in san fransisco

reviews.text: wharfe. One of the hop on hop off bus tours stops about 50 yards from the front of the hotel. The cable car turn rounds are just a couple of blocks away withing easy reach of the hotel. The hotel
reviews.title: Ideal location for a few days
Okay...
reviews.text: is very clean, the front desk staff are exceedingly helpful. The rooms are clean, with plenty of
coffee and tea replenished each day. The breakfast is free, and has an excellent choice. It is a
reviews.title: visting san francisco

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When I booked this hotel, one of the main considerations was proximity to Pier 35 as we were taking a cruise to Alaska. We settled on the Holiday Inn Express after trolling through the many reviews on the different hotels in the Fisherman's Wharf area, and I'm happy to say it fit the bill exactly.
reviews.title: Does the job with great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you're looking for a hotel with lots of history and character, don't come here. However, if all you need is a comfortable bed, a quiet room, a safe location and friendly service it's perfect. Previous reviews had also mentioned asking for a room facing the courtyard to minimise noise - I included this when making my internet booking, and our wish was granted, with our room also being on the top floor. Our flight from Australia was scheduled to arrive around 10.30am, but a quick call to the hotel a couple of days before confirmed they had a luggage room if we needed to kill a couple of hours before check-in. Imagine our surprise and pleasure when, on arriving at the hotel around midday, we were given our room straight away.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in San Fran

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has a free business centre near reception, with two PCs with internet access, plus a printer. There's also a breakfast area on the ground floor, with a free continental breakfast included in the price. It's not exactly gourmet, and our first experience there was a little overwhelming as a large school group were staying - enough said! However, the Hollywood Cafe a couple of doors down did a great lunchtime BLT, so I'd imagine their breakfast was pretty good too. There's a pretty good sports bar/restaurant right across the street, plus there's also a Safeway and a Walgreens a block or so east on North Point.
reviews.title: well impressed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found the staff unfailingly helpful and friendly, the bed was very comfortable, and the room EXTREMELY quiet. The hotel's just far enough away from the main action at Fisherman's Wharf to be quiet, but is just a five minute walk away.Once we checked out, Pier 35 was an easy walk of 5 blocks, towing our bags along. While this style of hotel may not be to everyone's taste, it does the job well.
reviews.title: excellent choice

reviews.text: We are members of Priority Club so we booked a reward night for one night. This hotel is modern & clean, and the staff was very friendly. Valet parking is $37 per night which is average for the area. The hotel is in a great location with walking distance to all major attractions. The complimentary breakfast was good too. We will stay here again for sure, its a great hotel.
reviews.title: OK stay - could have been better

likes.disliked: — Room no up to par of other HI Express rooms Ive stayed at

reviews.text: This hotel was just great. Breakfast had lots of hot choices, staff was nice, good location and price was good for the area.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel for the money

reviews.text: My family and I just completed a stay at this hotel and would highly recommend it for anyone looking for a good, clean hotel at a decent price. The location of this hotel was great - two blocks from Fisherman's Wharf and two blocks from the cable car line. The staff was very helpful. The iron in the room malfunctioned one morning when we were rushing to get to a tour and a security guard brought up a new iron since the housekeeping staff hadn't started yet. Also, our flight home wasn't until 12:30 a.m. and we stayed at the hotel until 9:30 p.m. and paid a day rate which was only 50% of the normal rate. This enabled us to continue to sightsee on our last day and then clean up and relax before going to the airport. The expanded continental breakfast is quick and easy and everyone was always able to find something they liked to start the day. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone traveling with a family on vacation.
reviews.title: Great hotel, Great Value for Families

likes.liked: — Expanded Free Continental Breakfast, Room Size, Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived early several hours before check-in time and were pleased that we were able to check right in. The hotel is in a very convenient location, easy walking to all the Fisherman's Wharf attractions. It's also very close to the several cable car stops and has a taxi waiting area right across the street. We had a fair sized king room on the fourth floor with a king sized bed. The room was clean and comfortable but with no view. The hectic complimentary buffet breakfasts were convenient but they were often slow replenishing items that were finished. Front desk service was friendly and helpful. Price could have been a little lower but overall a perfectly fine stay.
reviews.title: Great Stay

likes.liked: — Large comfortable bed and convenient location to attractions and transportation.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 3 nights (June 12-15, 2008) in a King room on the 1st floor. There was no view, just a courtyard of windows - but that didn't matter, because we were sightseeing from morning til night and I was too tired to care when we were finished.
reviews.title: Great location - room - service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you need a nice hotel, in a great/safe location, with a clean room & free breakfast - look no further. We got a rate of $187 per night through the hotels website - and when you factor in the complimentary breakfast - that's a pretty good deal. There is plenty to eat - not just danish & coffee. They had hot cinnamon rolls, cold cereal, carton milk, eggs (scrambled or omelet depending on the day), bacon or sausage (depending on the day) biscuits and gravy (daily), and then breads, english muffins and bagels. If this doesn't work for you, there is a Denny's literally right around the corner - as well as a Walgreen in case you need pop/water, medicine, sunscreen, snacks, toothpaste, film developing, socks - or anything else you forgot or think you might need.
reviews.title: Nice Location, Parking Pricey

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 5 nights (June 10-14) in 2008. The room was ready upon arrival and was very clean. We called ahead to ask for a room along the north face of the hotel as this would give us a view out towards the bay. When we got there we were told they really didn't reserve rooms in spots just details like King bed or non-smoking. So our view was just another wall of the hotel. Other than that, the staff was extremely nice and I realize that everyone would want that view so I guess it's just the luck of the draw.
reviews.title: Convenient, clean hotel with good service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The complimentary breakfast was pretty good. They had cinnamon rolls, bananas, bagels, various cereals, bread for toast, bacon or sausage (seemed to alternate), biscuits, gravy, milk and various juices. There may have been more but we can't remember. The food was good (not great). And the crowds were generally not too bad except for Saturday morning.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room wasn't large but it was fine for what we wanted. Just a place to relax between excursions around San Francisco. It was very clean and had a decent decor for a regular hotel. The staff was always friendly and willing to answer any questions we had.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel - Great Location

reviews.text: We considered it an excellent deal for the price we got off Hotwire as the location near Fisherman's Wharf was the best feature of the hotel. A quick walk to several attractions made our sightseeing easier. We didn't rent a car because so many forms of public transportation are within a couple of blocks from the hotel. The selection of television channels were pretty sparse but we didn't spend tons of time in the room aside from showering and sleeping so that didn't bother us too much. I would suggest trying to find a deal online if you can. We saw a guy walk in off the street and they were asking $239.00 for the one room they had.
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel June 6-9, in King Bed standard room. Room was very clean and nicely decorated although not overly big (but who cares...your not going to SF to stay in your room!)
reviews.title: Good hotel - would stay again

reviews.text: Could find nothing wrong with this hotel.
reviews.title: Great location for families

reviews.text: Room size was good with 2 x queen size beds for 4 of us (2 adults and 2 children). Bathroom was excellent. Also very quiet considering our room was at street level.
reviews.title: We liked it!!

reviews.text: Internet access via 2 computers near the lobby.
reviews.title: Great Location & hotel

likes.disliked: — There was nothing we didn't like.

reviews.text: Continental breakfast was adequate.
reviews.title: Could not be more pleased!

likes.disliked: — No hot food on breakfast buffet.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Plenty of shops and restaurants nearby, including those at Fisherman's Whart. Starbucks just around the corner.
reviews.title: just ideal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location , very clean but they gave us two double beds that were more like king singles so we opted to sleep separately as very uncomfortable together.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are so many restaurants in this area within walking distance and the cable car close by for $2 if you want to go up to union square or castro street. We also hired bikes and rode across the Golden Gate bridge which is a must do when you are in San Fransisco .
reviews.title: Great Hotel in the Fisherman's Wharf Area
Excellent location, great value
reviews.text: The pros: Clean hotel; great location within walking distance of the Wharf area and Ghiradelli Square; friendly hotel staff; nice free breakfast buffet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The cons: poor view from hotel room; a little confusing to find because of close proximity to another Holiday Inn; $45 a day parking fee
reviews.title: It's Just Average

reviews.text: Overall, a wonderful hotel. I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Great location and value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: --This was the perfect location. Very close to Ghiradelli Square, cable cars, the waterfront and the F Trolley.
reviews.title: Spotless and Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: --Our room was absolutely spotless. Basic and met our needs. Great water pressure. No flat screen TV just a tube TV, oh well.
reviews.title: A Perfect Spot to Stay

reviews.text: --Customer service was great (although we asked for very little.)
reviews.title: Great location for price!

reviews.text: --Breakfast was just the basics and perfect. Good coffee with real cream in excellent travel cups. Plentiful toast with good butter. Name brand yogurt and little cartons of milk. And if you want fruit, you must like bananas. Juice machine. Also scary eggs, sausage and extremely unhealthy cinnamon buns and muffins. Take as much as you want, take it back to your room whatever. There seemed to be no rules, but everything ran very smoothly.
reviews.title: Great stay, perfect location

reviews.text: --I liked the large open check-in foyer with seating for breakfast. It was always active with different languages, kids on school trips. A little chaotic, but never a problem. Gave a nice buzz to the hotel.
reviews.title: SAD

aka: Holiday Inn Express Hotel And Suites San Francisco Fisherman`s Wharf
description: Whether for business or leisure, reserve a stay at Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites in San Francisco Fisherman s Wharf. At a top option among San Francisco hotels near Fisherman s Wharf, delight in a locale with easy access to attractions including: Pier 39, Ghirardelli Square, Alcatraz and Bay Cruise Ferries while cable cars nearby provide transportation to Union Square, Chinatown and Moscone Convention Center. Experience the Bay City from the comfort of our San Francisco lodging. Enjoy a complimentary continental breakfast at our downtown San Francisco, California hotel before exploring the area. At day s end, retreat to our San Francisco hotel and unwind in a spacious room appointed with our plush Simple Smart Bedding Collection, high speed Internet access and Sony PlayStations. Upgrade to our San Francisco suites providing wet bars with microwaves and refrigerators. Complimentary amenities include local phone calls, a business center and a fitness center. Travel San Francisco and book your room at Holiday Inn Express Fisherman s Wharf hotel for unrivaled comfort and value. Check our specials for superb savings on San Francisco, California vacations.
